Counter strike source is a classic first person shooter. A big fps fan myself i reccomend this game to all those who want to experience the origin of fps, the original concept of first person shooter gameplay. Th is game is one of the most challenging first persin shooters as the enemy is as powerful as you are and you have no advantage unlike most first person shooters. This is one of the most immersive first person shooter out of the call of duty, and battlefield series. A must for all FPS fans who want to experience true fps and all those who want to play fps on their pcs but dont have the specs to run high-end games.

nice game for fps player

It's like CS:GO, but without the skins and valve matchmaking.

When I shoot with an Magnum Sniper Rifle (costs $4750 just like the AWP) in CS:S, the shot misses when it should miss and it hits when it should hit. It feels a lot more accurate than the AWP in CS:GO; in CS:GO, the AWP sometimes misses when it feels like it should hit. I haven't hit any good flick shots in CS:S yet.

I couldn't figure out how to turn down the volume for microphones while keeping the game volume good... Also, some servers have really loud sounds when players are "dominating" eachother, or when players get headshots on eachother.

I haven't played CS:S much, but it sometimes seems like I get killed by people before they even peek around walls or doors. There definitely is a peeker's advantage in this game, but I'm not sure if it's overpowered or not. 

Good game. 9/10
